definition: Guangyun, Chinese rime dictionary 韻書|韵书[yun4 shu1] from 11th century, containing 26,194 single-character entries
surname Guang
"house on a cliff" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 53), occurring in 店, 序, 底 etc
wide/numerous/to spread
the final (of a syllable) (Chinese phonology)/rhyme/appeal/charm/(literary) pleasant sound

sentences.english: Visitors will enter through the Guangyun Entrance which is located at the north-east part of the exposition site.
sentences.chinese: 游客从位于展览东北部的广韵入口进入。

sentences.english: There are 17 sounds whose phonological positions in Wang-san are different from those in Guang-yun.
sentences.chinese: 《王三》中有17个小韵与《广韵》音韵地位不同。

sentences.english: According to our statistics, Chen Li has cut 120 syllables from .
sentences.chinese: 据我们统计，陈澧共删去了《广韵》120个小韵。

definition: Jiyun, Chinese rime dictionary with 53,525 single-character entries, published in 11th century
Yupian, Chinese dictionary compiled by Gu Yewang 顧野王|顾野王[Gu4 Ye3 wang2] in 6th century AD
Qieyun, the first Chinese rime dictionary from 601 AD, containing 11,500 single-character entries
see 反切[fan3 qie4]
loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
sound and meaning
see 說文解字|说文解字[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4]
rime dictionary (ancient type of Chinese dictionary that collates characters by tone and rhyme rather than by radical)
Zhengzitong, Chinese character dictionary with 33,549 entries, edited by Ming scholar Zhang Zilie 張自烈|张自烈[Zhang1 Zi4 lie4] in 17th century
Shuowen Jiezi, the original Han dynasty Chinese character dictionary with 10,516 entries, authored by Xu Shen 許慎|许慎[Xu3 Shen4] in 2nd century
Commentary on Shuowen Jiezi (1815) by Duan Yucai 段玉裁[Duan4 Yu4 cai2]
entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
original form of a Chinese character
Leipian, Chinese character dictionary with 31,319 entries, compiled by Sima Guang 司馬光|司马光[Si1 ma3 Guang1] et al in 11th century
falling tone/fourth tone in modern Mandarin
Middle Chinese (linguistics)
thirty six initial consonants of Song phonetic theory
